name: aligned
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the same as or similar to something else: Our business model will become more aligned with the needs of our customers.
supporting or agreeing with another person, organization, or view: He resigned, saying the president should appoint someone who was more aligned with his views.
More examplesFewer examplesWe aim to create a service where our goals and yours are totally aligned.As a result of these changes, my value system and my daily work are more aligned.We compete against each other on the football field, but otherwise we have aligned interests.He didn't have a restaurant background, but his beliefs were so aligned with mine that I knew we could be partners.You'd have a hard time finding any five people more aligned politically than these men.I've found that unions and employers are completely aligned on bringing health-care costs down.
